1.brief: to draw, used in a great variety of applications (including to sow, to sound, to prolong, to develop, to march, to remove, to delay, to be tall, etc.)
a wreathed animal, i.e. a serpent (especially the crocodile or some other large sea-monster); figuratively, the constellation of the dragon; also as a symbol of Babylon

a rope (as twisted), especially a measuring line; by implication, a district or inheritance (as measured); or a noose (as of cords); figuratively, a company (as if tied together); also a throe (especially of parturition); also ruin
to subside; by implication, to be overflowed, cease; causatively, to abate, subdue
the tongue (of man or animals), used literally (as the instrument of licking, eating, or speech), and figuratively (speech, an ingot, a fork of flame, a cove of water)

2.brief: to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)
a bulrush (as growing there); collectively a rope of bulrushes
properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire
a thorn; by analogy, a ring forthe nose
to puncture, literally (to perforate, with more or less violence) or figuratively (to specify, designate, libel)
the cheek (from its fleshiness); hence, the jaw-bone

3.brief: near, with or among; often in general, to
used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
near, with or among; often in general, to
tender (literally or figuratively); by implication, weak

4.brief: to cut (off, down or asunder); by implication, to destroy or consume; specifically, to covenant (i.e. make an alliance or bargain, originally by cutting flesh and passing between the pieces)
a compact (because made by passing between pieces of flesh)
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
to take (in the widest variety of applications)
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always

5.brief: to laugh (in pleasure or detraction); by implication, to play
to tie, physically (gird, confine, compact) or mentally (in love, league)

6.brief: properly, to dig; figuratively, to plot; generally, to bore or open
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
to cut or split in two; to halve
between (repeated before each noun, often with other particles); also as a conjunction, either...or
a Kenaanite or inhabitant of Kenaan; by implication, a pedlar (the Canaanites standing for their neighbors the Ishmaelites, who conducted mercantile caravans)

7.brief: to fill or (intransitively) be full of, in a wide application (literally and figuratively)
a dart (as pointed like a thorn)
skin (as naked); by implication, hide, leather
a clatter, i.e. (abstractly) whirring (of wings); (concretely) a cricket; also a harpoon (as rattling), a cymbal (as clanging)
the head (as most easily shaken), whether literal or figurative (in many applications, of place, time, rank, itc.)

8.brief: to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the hollow hand or palm (so of the paw of an animal, of the sole, and even of the bowl of a dish or sling, the handle of a bolt, the leaves of a palm-tree); figuratively, power
properly, to mark (so as to be recognized), i.e. to remember; by implication, to mention;  to be male
a battle (i.e. the engagement); generally, war (i.e. warfare)
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to add or augment (often adverbial, to continue to do a thing)

9.brief: to lie (i.e. deceive), literally or figuratively
properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and
near, with or among; often in general, to
a view (the act of seeing); also an appearance (the thing seen), whether (real) a shape (especially if handsome, comeliness; often plural the looks), or (mental) a vision
to pitch over or reel; hence (transitively) to cast down or out

10.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
violent; by implication deadly; also (in a good sense) brave
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
to place (any thing so as to stay); reflexively, to station, offer, continue

11.brief: who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
to project (one self), i.e. precede; hence, to anticipate, hasten, meet (usually for help)
to be safe (in mind, body or estate); figuratively, to be (causatively, make) completed; by implication, to be friendly; by extension, to reciprocate (in various applications)
the bottom (as depressed); only adverbially, below (often with prepositional prefix underneath), in lieu of, etc.
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are

12.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

to scratch, i.e. (by implication) to engrave, plough; hence (from the use of tools) to fabricate (of any material); figuratively, to devise (in a bad sense); hence (from the idea of secrecy) to be silent, to let alone; hence (by implication) to be deaf (as an accompaniment of dumbness)
a brag or lie; also a liar
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
force (literally or figuratively); by implication, valor, victory

13.brief: who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
to denude (especially in a disgraceful sense); by implication, to exile (captives being usually stripped); figuratively, to reveal
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
a garment (literally or figuratively); by implication (euphemistically) a wife
a halter (as restraining); by implication, the jaw
who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)

14.brief: something swinging, i.e. the valve of adoor
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
to open wide (literally or figuratively); specifically, to loosen, begin, plough, carve
(as noun) a circle, neighbour, or environs; but chiefly (as adverb, with or without preposition) around
a tooth (as sharp); specifically  ivory; figuratively, a cliff
fright; concrete, an idol (as a bugbear)

15.brief: arrogance or majesty; by implication, (concretely) ornament
properly, containing, i.e. a tube; also a bed or valley of astream; also a strong thing or a hero
a shield (i.e. the small one or buckler); figuratively, a protector; also the scaly hide of the crocodile
to shut up; figuratively, to surrender
narrow; (as a noun) a tight place (usually figuratively, i.e. trouble); also a pebble ; (transitive) an opponent (as crowding)

16.brief: properly, united, i.e. one; or (as an ordinal) first
properly, united, i.e. one; or (as an ordinal) first

to be or come (causatively, bring) near (for any purpose); euphemistically, to lie with a woman; as an enemy, to attack; religious to worship; causatively, to present; figuratively, to adduce an argument; by reversal, to stand back

wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
between (repeated before each noun, often with other particles); also as a conjunction, either...or

17.brief: a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
a brother (used in the widest sense of literal relationship and metaphorical affinity or resemblance (like father))
properly, to impinge, i.e. cling or adhere; figuratively, to catch by pursuit
to catch (in a net, trap or pit); generally, to capture or occupy; also to choose (by lot); figuratively, to cohere
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to break through, i.e. spread or separate (oneself)

18.brief: to be clear (orig. of sound, but usually of color); to shine; hence, to make ashow, to boast; and thus to be (clamorously) foolish; to rave; causatively, to celebrate; also to stultify
illumination or (concrete) luminary (in every sense, including lightning, happiness, etc.)
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
an eyelash (as fluttering); figuratively, morning ray

19.brief: the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to
to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively)
properly, something struck off, i.e. a spark (as struck)
properly, to be smooth, i.e. (by implication) to escape (as if by slipperiness); causatively, to release or rescue; specifically, to bring forth young, emit sparks

20.brief: to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.
smoke, literally or figuratively (vapor, dust, anger)
a pot (for boiling); also (by resemblance of shape) a basket
to puff, in various applications (literally, to inflate, blow hard, scatter, kindle, expire; figuratively, to disesteem)
a bulrush (as growing there); collectively a rope of bulrushes

21.brief: properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
properly, to lick, i.e. (by implication) to blaze
a flash; figuratively, a sharply polished blade or point of aweapon
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to
to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.

22.brief: the back of the neck (as that on which burdens are bound)
to stop (usually over night); by implication, to stay permanently; hence (in a bad sense) to be obstinate (especially in words, to complain)
strength in various applications (force, security, majesty, praise)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)

23.brief: a falling off, i.e. chaff; also something pendulous, i.e. a flap
flesh (from its freshness); by extension, body, person; also (by euphemistically) the pudenda of aman
properly, to impinge, i.e. cling or adhere; figuratively, to catch by pursuit
properly, to pour out (transitive or intransitive); by implication, to melt or cast as metal; by extension, to place firmly, to stiffen or grow hard
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, a failure; by implication nothing; usually (adverb) not at all; also lest
to waver; by implication, to slip, shake, fall

24.brief: the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
properly, to pour out (transitive or intransitive); by implication, to melt or cast as metal; by extension, to place firmly, to stiffen or grow hard
a form of the prefix 'k-', but used separately  as, thus, so
properly, to pour out (transitive or intransitive); by implication, to melt or cast as metal; by extension, to place firmly, to stiffen or grow hard
lowermost; as noun (feminine plural) the depths (figuratively, a pit, the womb)

25.brief: an elevation or leprous scab; figuratively, elation or cheerfulness; exaltation in rank or character
properly, to turn aside from the road (for a lodging or any other purpose), i.e. sojourn (as a guest); also to shrink, fear (as in a strange place); also to gather forhostility (as afraid)
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
a fracture, figuratively, ruin; specifically, a solution (of a dream)
properly, to miss; hence (figuratively and generally) to sin; by inference, to forfeit, lack, expiate, repent, (causatively) lead astray, condemn

26.brief: drought; also a cutting instrument (from its destructive effect), as a knife, sword, or other sharp implement
properly, failure, i.e. nothing or destruction; usually (with preposition) without, not yet, because not, as long as, etc.
to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)
a lance (for thrusting, like pitching a tent)
a missile (spear or arrow); also a quarry (whence stones are, as it were, ejected)

27.brief: properly, to plait or interpenetrate, i.e. (literally) to weave or (generally) to fabricate; figuratively, to plot or contrive (usually in a malicious sense); hence (from the mental effort) to think, regard, value, compute
properly, material, i.e. (specifically) refuse haum or stalks of grain (as chopped in threshing and used for fodder)
iron (as cutting); by extension, an iron implement
a tree (from its firmness); hence, wood (plural sticks)

28.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to bolt, i.e. figuratively, to flee suddenly
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
a bow, forshooting (hence, figuratively, strength) or the iris
to turn about or over; by implication, to change, overturn, return, pervert
a sling; also a (door) screen (as if slung across), or the valve (of the door) itself

29.brief: properly, to plait or interpenetrate, i.e. (literally) to weave or (generally) to fabricate; figuratively, to plot or contrive (usually in a malicious sense); hence (from the mental effort) to think, regard, value, compute
to laugh (in pleasure or detraction); by implication, to play
properly, something to strike with, i.e. a dart

30.brief: the bottom (as depressed); only adverbially, below (often with prepositional prefix underneath), in lieu of, etc.
to spread (a bed); by implication, to refresh
properly, incised or (active) incisive; hence (as noun masculine or feminine) a trench (as dug), gold (as mined), a threshing-sledge (having sharp teeth); (figuratively) determination; also eager
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

31.brief: a pot; also a thorn (as springing up rapidly); by implication, a hook
a deep place (of water or mud)

a sea (as breaking in noisy surf) or large body of water; specifically (with the article), the Mediterranean Sea; sometimes a large river, or an artifical basin; locally, the west, or (rarely) the south
to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)
abstractly, a seasoning (with spicery); concretely, an unguentkettle (for preparing spiced oil)

32.brief: properly, the hind part; generally used as an adverb or conjunction, after (in various senses)
to be (causative, make) luminous (literally and metaphorically)

properly, to plait or interpenetrate, i.e. (literally) to weave or (generally) to fabricate; figuratively, to plot or contrive (usually in a malicious sense); hence (from the mental effort) to think, regard, value, compute
an abyss (as a surging mass of water), especially the deep (the main sea or the subterranean watersupply)

33.brief: a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
dust (as powdered or gray); hence, clay, earth, mud
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
properly, failure, i.e. nothing or destruction; usually (with preposition) without, not yet, because not, as long as, etc.
concretely, crushed; also afraid; abstractly, terror

34.brief: properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
